title: The Cartilage Gate
description: Under lanterns shaded green at Phosphor House, the triple-seal was inked across bone and cord: the Order’s vigil-mark, the Riverwarden’s tide-stamp, and the Grey Lantern cipher that burns without smoke. Sternum Plaza murmured with rumor as oath-posts cooled, yet when the winch bells tolled, silence pooled at the mouth of the Wyrmwell and the air took on the taste of old storms. The procession moved with liturgic patience: Prior Edris Thale robed in ash-white with the Bone Bell’s shadow stitched at his hem; Suri Yal in stained leather with gate-bearings sketched on her cuffs; Grey Lanterns masked and gloved, their shutters whispering the truce-tone; and Iriel Vask with the Singglass Resonance Lens cradled like a heart that dared not beat. In the descent, lantern runes ticked past like measured breaths, and far below, the cartilage gate lay like a sleeping lip, its seam stitched with prayer knots and the fear of three generations. The plan was a chord and a surgery: map the stress lines with singglass; set the Needle’s key-tone in the mortal ear of the gate; draw the Consecrated Ash-Cords through the seam in a rite as gentle as a midwife’s hand; and when the wyrm’s last breath stirred, bottle a portion in a sanctioned vessel so its weather might serve canals and funerals, not wreck them. Yet the Hollow Pilgrims were already in the dark, having blunted a winch tooth and woven rope-halters with taboos meant to choke oaths at the throat; they meant to break the city’s habit of debt with a miracle no one could weigh. The choice is not whether to open, but which music and which mercy to trust: a surgeon’s opening, a Lantern’s misdirection, a Cantor’s parley, or a sluicewright’s thunder. The wyrm’s bones hummed a warning—ribs creaked in distant answer—and all who heard knew that mistakes would echo for centuries.
objectives: Descend the Wyrmwell with Edris Thale, Suri Yal, and a Grey Lantern detachment.
Use the Singglass Resonance Lens to map stress lines around the cartilage gate.
Perform the pacification rite with the Consecrated Ash-Cords while sounding the Needle tone to unlock the gate safely.
Thwart the Hollow Pilgrims’ sabotage and capture a portion of the wyrm’s last breath in a sanctioned vessel.

dialogue.speaker: Edris Thale
dialogue.lines: I have no interest in waking legends, for legends wake hungry and feed on truth until even prayer sounds like boasting. I have a lively interest in keeping the living from learning how cheaply we will spend them when we panic, because panic is a tax upon hope that the poor pay first and worst. We open this gate as surgeons, not zealots; we will cut only what must be cut, and we will stitch what we cut as if our hands remembered every name that bled beneath them. We will close it like archivists, gloved and mindful, knowing that some pages turn to ash if thumbed in haste and some to wisdom if breathed upon. Sing with me, Iriel Vask, and we will lay a mercy over what wants to be a miracle, for mercy is the only miracle that leaves the world stronger than it found it.

dialogue.speaker: Suri Yal
dialogue.lines: If the breath is wind, I will tie it to a mast with knots I learned under floodlight and curses I learned from cracked bearings. If it is weather, I will pour it into a gate and make it lift water as a mule lifts a barge, stubborn but steady, because a city cannot feed on wonder alone. If it is something else, I will swear at it until it behaves and then apologize to the bone for my tongue, for I have found that machines and gods alike respect plain speech after the shouting is done. Keep the Lanterns from stepping where I am stepping, keep the Pilgrims from cutting our ropes, and when the seam sighs, push like you mean the city to live until dawn becomes a habit again. We tuned a bearing together once and saved a gate from tearing; tonight we tune a throat so the whole city can keep speaking in one piece.

dialogue.speaker: Tamsin Veil
dialogue.lines: Green flame is truce and green flame is truth, and both can be seen but not heard by those who come to break what they cannot fix. My couriers will hold the lines like whispers hold a secret, and my shutters will tell the Pilgrims three different stories, none of them lies and none of them fully true, until their courage knots into confusion. I have buried too many messengers to let a rope-halter teach another one of my own how silence tastes, so my debt to this city is already paid in quiet coins. If the Needle’s tone rings wrong, I will signal the counter-beat, and you will breathe when I tell you to breathe, because timing is a tide and I have learned to drown only when the river is asleep. Do your craft as if a rumor is listening, Iriel, because it is, and tonight we will teach it to carry a careful song instead of a scream.

dialogue.speaker: Cor Yune
dialogue.lines: I have set the cipher plates to mirror your lens, Magus Vask, so that what you see in stress will be what we can flash in shutter-script if the need cuts quick. The Pilgrims have braided prohibitions into their halters, three knots per taboo, and if you touch them in the wrong order they will eat the name of the hand that holds them, which is why I am wearing gloves lined with borrowed names. The winch-tooth they blunted is a hymn in iron; I have taught it a counter-hymn that will hold for one descent and one ascent, no more, so please do not teach me what a second failure feels like. I am not brave, but I am stubborn, and stubbornness in the dark is sometimes bravery wearing a mask that fits better. When you lower the ash-cords, count with me, because numbers are prayers that even doubters can keep.

dialogue.speaker: Jull Nerr
dialogue.lines: I signed the tide-stamp because the Council could not argue fast enough to matter, and because if this goes wrong I would rather be the man who saw it coming than the man who explains a drowned city to a dry court. You have my militia at the crown and you have my patience at the length of a single breath, no longer, because gates do not wait for philosophy when pressure chooses a side. Iriel Vask, you have pulled my gates out of a scream once, and for that I own you a grudging nod and the courtesy of not kicking you out of my docks tonight. If I smell a stunt, if I catch a whiff of Collegium curiosity where a Riverwarden’s caution ought to be, I will cut the hoist and blame the Pilgrims before my men know I am lying. Come back with a bottled wind and with my people breathing, and I will raise a silent toast where even the river can hear I kept my word.

dialogue.speaker: Hollow Pilgrim Cantor
dialogue.lines: Do you not crave to hear it like a child craves an untold story, like a debtor craves amnesty, like a priest craves proof that the altar is listening? The bone’s hymn has been smothered by ledgers and laws until it hums only to soothe those who profit by sleep, but beneath us the skull is a cathedral and the choir is a weather waiting to be forgiven. You will bottle a storm and sell it by the cup and call it salvation, and the price will be written in cords around the wrists of those who were never asked. We will break the cup and drown in what is honest, because drowning is cleaner than debt, and death is the only creditor who cannot be bribed. If you love this city, you will open it wide and let it breathe, because breath that is owned by no one belongs to everyone, and that is how wonder pays its tithe.

dialogue.speaker: Lysa Truin
dialogue.lines: I gave you the lens because you learned to listen with your hands and your patience before you trusted your cleverness, and that is rarer than star-glass that sings true. Remember that resonance is relationship; it is never one note forcing another, it is always a negotiation wherein both parties leave with their identity intact. The Needle tone is a key because keys have teeth, and teeth can bite when forced, so be gentle when you turn and firmer only when the lock stutters in fear. The city is listening through you tonight, and it will remember in its bones the way you speak to it, whether you raise your voice in triumph or lay it down in care. Come back with questions sharpened by mercy, not answers dulled by victory, and I will open the restricted archives as if they were a garden in spring.

dialogue.speaker: Iriel Vask
dialogue.lines: I crave it, yes, and I will not let that craving make me cruel, because cruelty rings off bone like a false note and echoes longer than triumph. We will hear enough to know why it sleeps and then cork the rest, because a good night does not end with shouting, it ends with breath finding its calm. If wonder is owed to us, we will earn it with patience instead of robbery, and we will spend it like a careful dowry, not a gambler’s last coin. If the wyrm chose to hold shut a wound, I will not be the knife that unlearns that choice, but I will be the needle that sutures what time and fear have frayed. Walk with me, all of you, in a rhythm that steadies the hand and sweetens the courage, for a city may be heavy but it moves easiest when lifted together.

choices.title: Surgeon’s Opening
choices.text: Iriel aligns the Singglass Resonance Lens to the cartilage seam and breathes with Edris in five-count measures, letting the Lens paint pale constellations of stress and solace along the sleeping lip. The Consecrated Ash-Cords are warmed between palms, not to appease a spirit but to remind the living that warmth makes threads kinder, and they are threaded through prayer knots like needles through old lace. Suri calls cadence under her breath, a sailor’s lullaby turned metronome, and the Needle tone is eased in not as a spear but as a key offered with a bow. The Lanterns hold the perimeter with shutters closed to slits, their masks reflecting soft green upon iron and ligament, while Cor Yune whispers numbers that keep fear from multiplying. When the seam sighs, the party pushes not with force but with consent felt as a release, and the bottle’s mouth meets the breath like a midwife’s hand meeting a newborn’s first cry, reverent and ready.
choices.outcome: The cartilage gate unsticks with a tremor that ripples through the ribs above, but the tremor is a greeting instead of a shudder, and the city hums rather than creaks. The Hollow Pilgrims slink from the shadows when the truce-tone flashes thrice, knives still sheathed because even their fervor recognizes a rite done without theft, and Edris binds their zeal with oaths that taste of ash and promise. A measured gale pours into the sanctioned vessel, singing like rain in a dry season, and Suri slots the stopper with a turn that clicks home like a bearing well-tuned. Jull Nerr’s tide-stamp glows faintly in the hoist-lantern as if to nod, and the winch raises the company without a jolt, earning a silent cheer that tastes like iron and relief. The mission’s aims stand fulfilled in quiet order: the map is drawn, the rite is kept, the sabotage denied, and a portion of the wyrm’s last breath is captured for the city’s lawful needs.

choices.title: Lantern Gambit
choices.text: Iriel signals Tamsin for a curtain of green flickers, a living veil that writes a story upon rock which only reflections can read, drawing the Pilgrims’ eyes to a phantom opening down-slope. Cor Yune seeds the dark with decoy cords that chime like ash, each note an invitation to cut the wrong knot and learn humility from the sudden bite of a harmless ward. While faith and fear chase a shadowed gate, Suri unspools the true line and taps the Needle tone in sync with the tremor of the ribs, counting under her breath so softly it feels like a prayer someone forgot to outlaw. Edris chants low and flat, a mercy-song that never once pretends to be a miracle, and its restraint is the persuasion that convinces the seam it will not be betrayed. The Lens maps in quick strokes, constellations flashing and resolving, and when the sigh comes it is swallowed by a bottle already waiting like a cup offering water to a runner who asked rather than demanded.
choices.outcome: The Hollow Pilgrims chase ghosts into a cul-de-sac of their own conviction, where Lanterns step from shadow with truce-light steady and bind them without blood, letting zeal exhaust itself on the safest of truths. The hoist’s blunted tooth bites once and skids, but Tamsin has timed the counter-beat and the slip becomes a glide as if the river itself declined to watch a stumble. The captured breath is nimble and bright, quick to obey ash-seals and quicker to sing in pressure-channels that Suri sketches on her cuff, already dreaming of gates that lift with less labor. A few Riverwardens murmur about trickery, but Jull Nerr’s silence declares the tactic honest enough for a night that needed cleverness more than courage. All objectives are met: the descent secure, the mapping precise, the rite intact, the sabotage inverted upon its makers, and the vessel heavy with weather that can be turned to the city’s careful work.

choices.title: Cantor’s Parley
choices.text: Iriel steps toward the Hollow Pilgrim Cantor with the Lens held low and empty hands in the green dim, offering no argument save the time it takes for breathing to prove itself. Words are spent slowly like winter candles: one to admit the craving for wonder without shame, one to name the fear of debt without insult, one to honor the dead without hiring them, one to praise the boldness that refused to sell awe for coin, and one to ask whether drowning is truly more honest than stewardship. Edris does not interrupt, but he lends his presence like a wall one can lean against without owing rent, and the Bone Bell’s shadow along his hem seems to settle rather than threaten. Suri uses the quiet to tune the Needle tone against her own pulse, proving that craft can be reverent without being pious, and Cor Yune counts the knots in the Pilgrims’ halters, learning the logic of their taboos so he can unmake them gently. When the seam feels the room become a place where choice is not a weapon, it loosens of itself like a jaw unclenching at last, and the bottle is lifted not to capture but to host a breath that wishes to be borrowed and returned.
choices.outcome: The Cantor lowers his gaze and then his halter, conceding not defeat but the possibility that care can be courageous, and his flock follows because faith that bends without breaking is still faith. The Lanterns hold their lines without gloating, and Edris writes a temporary sanctum in ash where the Pilgrims may witness the rite without owning it, binding them to noninterference by cords that taste of dignity rather than shame. The vessel fills with a steady draft that smells of storm-cooled stone, and Suri seals it while whispering thanks, an oathwright’s gratitude wrapped in a mechanic’s economy. Jull Nerr grunts, which in his dialect is a blessing, and his hoist takes the weight as if the city itself agreed to lift. Every goal is faithfully achieved: descent and mapping done in peace, rite performed without trespass, sabotage dissolved into witness, and a portion of the wyrm’s last breath lawfully taken into keeping.

choices.title: Sluicewright’s Hammer
choices.text: When the blunted winch tooth jars the hoist and the seam shivers toward a howl, Iriel abandons elegance for a rescue chord, striking the Needle tone hard enough to shear panic away from purpose. Suri answers with counter-resonance, a fierce hum from her ribs to the bone around them, and the gate hears in that music the rough love of those who mend broken wheels under sleet rather than prayers in warm rooms. Edris folds a mercy into the thunder, flat and anchoring, a litany that refuses to rise with drama and thereby steals drama’s teeth. The Lens blazes with stress-constellations, and Iriel maps them by memory and intuition, drawing the ash-cord through weak lines like a surgeon suturing during an earthquake. The bottle is thrust into the sigh at the exact heartbeat between rupture and restraint, and the vessel takes a jagged gale that paws the seal before settling like a caged squall taught the shape of its pen.
choices.outcome: The Hollow Pilgrims spring their trap in that heartbeat and learn that passion without timing is just a bruise on fate; Lanterns crash into them with truce-light and binds, taking blows and giving none they will regret. A support strut complains and a handful of bone tiles crack, but the gate holds, persuaded not by softness alone but by a demonstration that force can be honest when it serves healing. Suri snarls through a grin as she ratchets the seal, and her hands shake only after the danger passes, when laughter and anger look too similar to separate. Jull Nerr’s men sweat under their helmets and pretend not to, and their hoist lifts the party with the quiet pride of those who kept their oaths in the ugliest way required. The mission’s success is undeniable: the descent survived, the mapping done in the teeth of risk, the rite battered but true, the sabotage broken like a wave on stone, and the wyrm’s breath captured for sanctioned use despite its temper.

rewards.description: 800 experience for mastering resonance under pressure, conducting a lawful rite, and bottling a portion of the wyrm’s last breath without calamity.
Vessel of the Wyrm’s Breath (Bound) — a sanctioned, seal-scripted flask containing a measured gale that answers to ash-cords and council writ.
Cartilage Gate Key-Tone Tuning — the precise tonal schema to unlock and pacify cartilaginous seals aligned to the Needle’s cadence.
40 chits — scrimshawed slivers matched in the Loom’s ledgers, payment for sanctioned descent and recovery.
Order of the Third Rib +2 — earned for honoring funerary law and performing the pacification rite without trespass.
Riverwardens of the No Echo +2 — earned for safeguarding gate integrity and returning with a controllable wind for sluice service.
Grey Lanterns +1 — earned for disciplined coordination under truce-light and keeping rumor from breaking the city’s nerve.
